title: Use EGL to replace X server dependency

content.raw:
`RenderEngine::CreateContext()` uses an X server on linux to create a context for opengl rendering. This adds extra work when running gzserver in the cloud or in a docker container

* Requires an X server running for rendering, even on headless machines
* When using Docker, have to mount a volume with a socket to an X server and start a container with a script that passes XAUTH data into the container.

 It looks like EGL can be used instead. [Here](https://github.com/VirtualGL/virtualgl/issues/10) is another project discussing it a year ago. [Here](https://gist.github.com/dcommander/ee1247362201552b2532) is an example that uses OpenGL without an X server. [Here](https://www.khronos.org/registry/EGL/sdk/docs/man/html/eglIntro.xhtml) is an introduction to EGL. [Here](https://devblogs.nvidia.com/parallelforall/egl-eye-opengl-visualization-without-x-server/) is an nvidia blog about using OpenGL without an X server.
